0.title: 2022 Undergraduate Research Support Application
0.description:
Application form through which students apply for Auvil, DeVlieg, Carson, Emeritus Society Grant in Arts or Humanities, WSU LSAMP, or TMP research awards.

Note: the deadline for submission of this form is Friday, January 21, 2022 by midnight.

fields.label: Award Intro HTML Block
fields.content:
Thanks to many generous supporters, the WSU Office of Undergraduate Research, WSU LSAMP program, WSU Team Mentoring Program (TMP), and the Emeritus Society award scholarships for an academic year (i.e., fall and spring semesters†) to students engaging in independent and mentored undergraduate research, scholarship, and creative activities. Scholarship awards will be paid directly into the student account of each recipient.

When Filling Out This Form

  • You can download a PDF preview of the entire application to familiarize yourself with the information you will be asked to provide.
  • Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and a left-hand crimson field border.
  • Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this application form so we can provide you with further assistance.
  • The submission deadline for this application is Friday, Jan. 21, 2022 by midnight.

General Eligibility Criteria

Though each scholarship has its own eligibility criteria, there are several criteria that each award has in common. Generally, an eligible applicant for these awards must:

  • Plan to be a current WSU student at the time the award is funded, which will be the August following submission of the application in February. (That is, students who graduate prior to the funding of awards in August are not eligible to receive an award.)
  • Submit this completed online application by Friday, Jan. 21, 2022 at midnight.
  • Have identified a WSU research mentor who will be able to submit a simple endorsement of your application by Friday, Jan. 28, 2022.
  • Agree to participate in SURCA if you receive an award. Specifically, students who are selected as recipients of these awards must apply to present at and participate in SURCA in the academic year in which their award is funded.

†Note: Currently, none of the awards associated with this form are granted to support summer research projects.

fields.label: Scholarship Selections Section Header
fields.content: Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this application form so we can provide you with further assistance.

fields.label: Scholarship Specifications HTML Block
fields.content:
To indicate which award(s) you are applying for, please select one or more scholarship/fellowship from the selections below. Please note that in addition to the general eligibility criteria you reviewed on the first page of this form, each award has additional specific eligibility criteria. Please review these criteria, which are listed below, before making your selections.

Auvil Scholars Fellowship

  • Open to all undergraduates
  • Open to all majors on all campuses
  • Preference given to new researchers

Carson Undergraduate Research Excellence Award

  • Preference given to juniors, seniors
  • Open to all majors on all campuses

DeVlieg Foundation Award

  • Open to sophomores, juniors
  • Major must be in Voiland College of Engineering and Architecture
  • Must have a GPA of 3.0 or better
  • Research project must be in area of renewable energy

Emeritus Society Grant in Arts and Humanities

  • Open to undergraduate students who are or will be engaged in mentored scholarship or creative activities in the arts and humanities

WSU Team Mentoring Program Awards

  • Must be in good academic standing
  • Open to STEM and pre-health majors
  • Must be active participants in the Team Mentoring Program

WSU LSAMP Research Award

  • Open to STEM majors who are underrepresented minority students
  • Must have a GPA of 3.0 or better
  • Recipients must actively participate in LSAMP programs

Your mentor is the person who is or will be supervising you in your research, scholarship, or creative activities. You should have already discussed this application with this person.

fields.label: HTML Block
fields.content: Please note that prior research experience is not a requirement. If you do not have prior research experience, you are encouraged to include work, leadership, or volunteer experiences that show excellent initiative, self-discipline, and/or focus to complete a successful research appointment.

0.schedulePendingMessage:
The application for 2022 Undergraduate Research Awards has not yet opened. The application will be opening Nov. 1, 2021. You can contact ug.research@wsu.edu if you have any further questions.

Last Year's Application (PDF) Tip: Take a look at a PDF preview of last year's application to help you prepare for your submission for this year.
0.scheduleMessage: The application for 2022 Undergraduate Research Awards is now closed. The deadline was Friday, January 21, 2022. You can contact ug.research@wsu.edu if you have any further questions.

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message:
Form Successfully Submitted

Thank you for your application, {Student Full Name (First):4.3}, which has been successfully submitted. You will soon be receiving a confirmation email at {Email:14} from ug.research@wsu.edu; if you have further questions, please send an email to that address. We will also be contacting your WSU mentor {Full name of research mentor (First):20.3} {Full name of research mentor (Last):20.6} at their email address {Mentor\'s Email:21} regarding a simple endorsement of your application.

{all_fields}

notifications.name: WSU Mentor Notification
notifications.subject: Request to endorse the application of {Student Full Name (First):4.3} {Student Full Name (Last):4.6} for undergraduate research awards
notifications.message:
Dear {Full Name of Faculty Mentor (First):20.3}:

This is an automated message being sent to notify you that {Student Full Name (First):4.3} {Student Full Name (Last):4.6} wishes to have you submit an endorsement of his or her application for Undergraduate Research Awards from our office. Please use our online form to submit your endorsement by Tuesday, March 9, 2021 at midnight:
https://undergraduateresearch.wsu.edu/funding/undergraduate-research-awards/mentor-endorsements/

The student has made the following scholarship selections in their application: {:9:value}. Information about these scholarships is available on the Office of Undergraduate Research website.

Through the generosity of many private donations and in partnership with the NSF-funded WSU LSAMP program, the Office of Undergraduate Research, the WSU Team Mentoring Program, and the WSU Emeritus Society at Washington State University are sponsoring independent undergraduate research, scholarship, or creative activity projects that are supervised by a WSU faculty or staff member. It was indicated in the application submitted by {Student Full Name (First):4.3} that you are his or her mentor, hence the reason for this request. To complete the student's application, your endorsement that will confirm that you have reviewed and do support the student’s application and their work must be submitted by midnight on Tuesday, March 9, 2021.

Thank you for your support.

Mary Sánchez Lanier, Ph.D.
Assistant Vice Provost
Office of Undergraduate Research
Division of Academic Engagement and Student Achievement (DAESA) at Washington State University
ug.research@wsu.edu

Yadira Paredes
WSU LSAMP Director
wsu.lsamp@wsu.edu

J. Manuel Acevedo
Team Mentoring Program Director
acevedo@wsu.edu

{all_fields}

notifications.name: For Students: Successful Form Submission
notifications.subject: Your submission of an application for undergraduate research awards was successful
notifications.message:
Dear {Student Full Name (First):4.3}:

We have successfully received your application for the following undergraduate research awards: {:9:value}. Thank you for your submission. Your WSU mentor, {Full Name of Faculty Mentor (First):20.3} {Full Name of Faculty Mentor (Last):20.6}, will be contacted shortly at {Mentor\'s Email:21} to review and provide an endorsement of your submission. We will be in touch with you in the future regarding the outcome of your application.

Sincerely,

Mary Sánchez Lanier, Ph.D.
Assistant Vice Provost
Office of Undergraduate Research
Division of Academic Engagement and Student Achievement (DAESA) at Washington State University
ug.research@wsu.edu

Yadira Paredes
WSU LSAMP Director
wsu.lsamp@wsu.edu

J. Manuel Acevedo
Team Mentoring Program Director
acevedo@wsu.edu

{all_fields}
